titleStmt.title: Description of Free Library of Philadelphia, Horace MS 1a: Ars Poetica and Epistulae
titleStmt.funder: Council on Library and Information Resources

availability.licence: These images and the content of Free Library of Philadelphia, Horace MS 1a: Ars Poetica and Epistulae are free of known copyright restrictions and in the public domain. See the Creative Commons Public Domain Mark page for usage details, http://creativecommons.org/publicdomain/mark/1.0/.

notesStmt.note: Probably once bound in with a larger manuscript, as seventeenth-century (?) folio numbering begins on fol. 1r with 89
Back Flyleaves 1 and 2 are part of quire 3

msContents.summary: This manuscript, the first of two volumes, contains the Ars Poetica and Epistulae by Horace. It was written in Austria or Hungary in the fourth quarter of the 15th century.

msItem.title: Letter from Maggs Bros. to Free Library, January 6, 1955

supportDesc.extent: ii+37+iv; 194 x 143 mm bound to 199 x 151 mm
supportDesc.foliation: Modern foliation in pencil, upper right recto; earlier (seventeenth century?) foliation in ink, upper middle recto, begins on fol. 1 with "89"

layoutDesc.layout: Single column of twenty-four to twenty-nine lines (most pages twenty-seven to twenty-eight); lines begin with capitals; drypoint frame-ruled, no line ruling; written area: 146 x 81 mm

binding.p: Modern binding, blue cloth with gold stamping over paper boards

history.provenance: Imre Hodossy; Purchased by Maggs Bros; LTD in 1955 for the Free Library at a Munich auction
